com.passkeysoft

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.passkeysoft.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    A java object representing a single instance of a playing card

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card(int suit, int value)
      Instantiates a new Card.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int suit,
            int value)
        Instantiates a new Card.
        Parameters:
        suit - An arbitrary integer value representing the suit of this card. All cards sharing this value will be considered to be of the same suit.
        value - An arbitrary integer value representing the face value of this card.

    • Method Detail

      • setOwner

        public Card setOwner(int owner)
        Sets the owner of this card, as an integer value.
        Parameters:
        owner - the new owner of the card, as an integer value
        Returns:
        the Card object affected, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • getOwner

        public int getOwner()
        Gets The owner value of this card.
        Returns:
        The owner of this card. 0 indicates that the card belongs to the deck, and by convention Deck.DISCARD (65535, 0xFFFF) indicates that the card has been discarded.

      • setRandom

        public Card setRandom(long randomNumber)
        Sets a random number for this card. Used by the Deck object to shuffle a deck
        Parameters:
        randomNumber - the random number to be assigned to this card. This method should only be used by the owning Deck instance, but I can't figure out how to make the compiler enforce this rule without making this class an inner class of Deck.
        Returns:
        the Card object affected, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • getRandom

        public long getRandom()
        Gets the random number assigned to this card. Probably not useful to anything other than the Deck class.
        Returns:
        the random number assigned to this card

      • setSuit

        public Card setSuit(int newSuit)
        Sets the suit. TODO: Normally, this should not be allowed. We might need to find some way to protect it.
        Parameters:
        newSuit - the new suit for the card
        Returns:
        the Card object affected, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        Gets an integer value representing the suit of this card
        Returns:
        the integer value representing the suit of this card

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Gets an integer representing the card's face value. Note that there is no setter for this property, it must be set exclusively in the constructor.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the card's face value.
